the Fading 'Value of Reality'

why.p3: RootLens combines hardware signatures from C2PA-compliant cameras with blockchain to properly evaluate and monetize this 'value of reality'.

q1.q: Can't I use it if I don't have a C2PA compatible camera?
q1.a: Currently, Sony Alpha 7 series, Google Pixel (specific models), Nikon Z9, Leica, etc. are supported, and compatible models are increasing rapidly. It is also being installed on smartphones, and it is expected to be available on more devices in the future. At this time, only images taken with these compatible devices are subject to 'Hardware Proof'.

q2.q: What is the difference from traditional stock photo sites?
q2.a: The biggest difference is the 'handling of ownership'. In Web2 services, it is just a record in a database, but in RootLens, ownership is linked to the user's wallet using blockchain (NFT). This enables free buying and selling and transfer of rights, and the true owner can be identified even in the unlikely event of a leak.

q3.q: Is it 'tamper-proof' thanks to the blockchain?
q3.a: No. Tamper detection and proof of authenticity of images are realized by 'C2PA' technology itself. The role of the blockchain is to record 'whose' proved content it is and to mobilize rights. By combining these two, both authenticity and ownership are secured.

q4.q: Why did you choose Solana and Arweave?
q4.a: Arweave is optimal for permanent storage of image data (large capacity), and Solana's cNFT (compressed NFT) technology was essential for issuing a large number of certificates (NFTs) at low cost. In a model where one certificate is issued per image, low gas fees and processing speed are very important.

technicalSpecsModal.verifySelf: How can I verify it myself?

technicalSpecsModal.aiDetail: The provenance information of this content includes records of processing using Generative AI or AI models. Detected actions are as follows:
technicalSpecsModal.aiNoneDetail: No clear record indicating generation or editing by AI was found in C2PA metadata. (* Possibility of processing by normal editing tools, manual creation, or camera shooting)
technicalSpecsModal.disclaimer: AI detection is based on information recorded in C2PA metadata by the software used during creation/editing. Even if 'No Record', the possibility of using non-C2PA compatible AI tools cannot be denied.
technicalSpecsModal.hashDesc: Files whose authenticity is guaranteed by C2PA and ownership on the blockchain are strongly linked by hash value.
technicalSpecsModal.bindingHashDesc: Unique ID of the downloaded file. By recording this ID on the blockchain, it can be identified that 'this file is the legitimate data linked to the NFT'.
technicalSpecsModal.arweaveDesc: The fact that 'a file with the above hash value exists' is permanently recorded on Arweave.
technicalSpecsModal.solanaDesc: Solana chain proves that the wallet holding this cNFT is the legitimate owner of the file with the above hash value.

technicalDetailsSection.section1Desc: The data 'fingerprint (hash value)' and ownership information are permanently recorded on the blockchain and will remain even after RootLens service ends.
technicalDetailsSection.arweaveItems: Content Hash Value,Root Signer Info,Link Info to cNFT
technicalDetailsSection.solanaItems: cNFT Issuance Info,Current Owner Wallet,Link Info to Arweave
technicalDetailsSection.privacyNote: It is mathematically impossible to restore original photos or personal information (such as face photos) from these hash data.
technicalDetailsSection.section2Desc: Uploaded files are stored in RootLens cloud storage and made publicly available to generate blockchain proof pages.
technicalDetailsSection.deleteNote: * You can delete data on the server at any time (images will no longer be viewable after deletion).
technicalDetailsSection.fileBodyDesc: Published in 'original state' including Exif information (location info, shooting date, model name, etc.).
technicalDetailsSection.metadataDesc: Digital signatures, edit history, thumbnails, etc. are displayed for verification.
technicalDetailsSection.exifWarning: RootLens cannot automatically delete file Exif information (location info, etc.) due to the mechanism to ensure data authenticity.
technicalDetailsSection.tamperWarning: Due to C2PA specifications, deleting or editing Exif information after shooting is judged as 'data tampering' and the signature becomes invalid. Therefore, it is impossible to 'prove authenticity' and 'hide home location info' at the same time.
technicalDetailsSection.checkBefore: Please check the Exif information in file properties before uploading.
technicalDetailsSection.stopUpload: If the signature contains personal information you do not want to disclose (such as home GPS info), please refrain from uploading.
technicalDetailsSection.section3Desc: RootLens uses mutual link technology to inseparable link 'data authenticity' and 'digital ownership'.
technicalDetailsSection.step1Desc: Records on Arweave (data) and cNFTs on Solana (rights) record each other's IDs to form a strong pair. This prevents 'hijacking' where someone claims ownership by creating a fake NFT later.
technicalDetailsSection.step2Desc: Anyone can leave records on the blockchain, but RootLens certifies only 'mutual link records with correct hash values and the oldest timestamp' as originals.
technicalDetailsSection.step3Desc: Transferring cNFT transfers ownership. Burning cNFT proves the fact that 'the owner of this data does not exist in this world (renunciation of rights)'.
technicalDetailsSection.hashDesc: Digital data 'fingerprint'. Since a completely different value is generated even if 1 bit is changed, it is used for tamper detection.
technicalDetailsSection.rootSignerDesc: Trusted organizations such as camera manufacturers like Sony and Canon, or Adobe. Guarantees the origin of data.
technicalDetailsSection.arweaveDesc: Semi-permanent data storage network. Leaves records as 'digital stone tablets'.
technicalDetailsSection.cnftDesc: Digital certificate on Solana. This represents 'ownership of this content'.

specs.title: RootLens Device Hash Specifications
specs.description: Specifications defining how RootLens interprets C2PA manifests from each device to extract the authentic ID (originalHash). This specification is public to ensure transparency and deterministic hash generation.
specs.cardDesc: The following table shows rules applied when a specific `Issuer` is identified. This ensures the same content ID is always generated from the same signature source.
specs.warningDesc:
For devices or software not included in the list above (those not matching trusted `claimGenerator`), RootLens will not extract a hash (it will result in an error).
This is a security measure to prevent incorrect hash usage or spoofing by unverified implementations.

If you encounter an error despite using a C2PA-compatible device, please contact the RootLens team. We will verify and add it to the list promptly.
